text: Jan de Bont (; born 22 October 1943) is a former Dutch cinematographer, director and movie producer. He was born in Eindhoven, Netherlands. He is widely known for directing the movies Speed and Twister. As a cinematographer, he is known for his works in Cujo, Flesh and Blood, Die Hard, The Hunt for Red October and Basic Instinct. He retired in 2012. While serving as cinematographer for the 1981 movie Roar, de Bont experienced one of many on- set injuries during filming, where a lion lifted his scalp, requiring 220 stitches.‘Roar’: Watch a Wild Behind-the-Scenes Look At Notorious Accident From Hollywood’s Most Dangerous Film ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1943 births Category:Living people Category:Dutch movie directors Category:Dutch movie producers Category:Cinematographers Category:People from Eindhoven
title: Jan de Bont
